Remarks:
AuditEvent

The following details are returned as part of the AuditEvent structure if AuditEvent data is included with this resource. For more information about AuditEvent, refer to the FHIR Search Parameters article in the Documentation section of this site.

Name

Description

Is Optional

Is Array

type (coding)

The type of event, either Ancillary Provider Update, Care Team Member Update, or Team Assignment Update.

false

false

recorded (instant)

The time and date the audit event happened.

false

false

agent (agent)

A user or system process that created the audit event. The agent and source elements return the same user.

false

true

agent.Requestor (Boolean)

 Always “True”.

false

false

agent.Who (reference)

 The user who caused the event.

false

false

source (source)

A user or system process that created the audit event. The agent and source elements return the same user.

false

true

source.Observer (reference)

The user who caused the event.

false

false

entity (entity)

A user or system process that created the audit event.

false

true

entity.detail.valueString (true)

Details of what data was changed in the audit event. The is a sentence that identifies the item that changed, the row in the list of ancillary providers or care team members, and what value the item was set to.

false

true

Bundle.Name: Bundle
Bundle.Description: Resource bundle. For more information, refer to the FHIR specification.

ancillary-provider-poc-update.Name: extension
ancillary-provider-poc-update.Description: A string that indicates whether each ancillary provider receives updates to the Plan of Care.

name.Name: name
name.Description: The name of the care team.

participant.Name: participant
participant.Description:
A participant in the care team.

In scenarios where a provider on the care team has multiple specialties, this service returns one participant element for each unique combination of provider and specialty. For example, if a provider is listed on the care team twice, once with a specialty of "Radiology" and once with a specialty of "Behavioral Health", there will be two participant elements returned by this resource. They will have the same member reference but will have different roles.

member.Name: member
member.Description: Reference to a care team member

period.Name: period
period.Description: The start date and end date of the participantâ€™s care team assignment.

participant-note.Name: extension
participant-note.Description: A string note that includes the number of visits with the participant each week and whether the participant receives Plan of Care updates.

period.Name: period
period.Description: The times the care team is active, from the earliest start date to the latest end date for any participant in the care team.

status.Name: status
status.Description: The status of the episode for which the care team is defined.
